channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SUREFIRE-969] Log line on screen output
item.description:
parallel='none', perCoreThreadCount=true, threadCount=2, useUnlimitedThreads=false

This log line is more for debugging, it would be great if it would be removed.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
It seems there is a 2.14.1 in progress, it would be great if this could be integrated. I don't upload patch, but it's just a single line to remove.

Thanks!

I'd like to keep the information, but move it to some actual debug logging. That requires some API change and is therefor not that suitable for a bug fix release.

Is this issue a deal-breaker for some use case you have, or is it just annoying?
It's just annoying . But it would be annoying enough to justify another surefire version upgrade on our side, and upgrading surefire requires some testing work I would prefer to avoid (obviously).

A lot of people running parallel tests (myself included!) have a need to see clearly which threading config is in use. The line is not going away

We might move it into the otherwise superfluous
---------
TESTS bla bla bla
---------

I suppose it depends on the setting. Here is an example of the output when using it with categories and reuse fork set to false. It would be great if it could be printed only once.
As a side note, I don't know why there are more logs lines that actual tests, I guess categories play a role in this.

-------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------

+1000 /that/ message is a total annoyance. It's supposed to come only once.

I suspect you're running fork=always with categories or similar. This should definitely be fixed
OK, I'll handle that. It's still too late for 2.14.1, I'm afraid (it's already half-way through the voting-phase).

Yep, I've seen that. Unfortunately, it's not an issue anymore: I've done some tests with surefire snapshot, and I have a regression linked to parameterized tests I can't yet isolate on a sample. So we will have to wait anyway... But hopefully 2.15 will make it!
You mean @RunWith(Parameterized.class)? Just today I created a bunch of those and they run with 2.14.1. Would be great if you find that sample - if not, please let us know anyway.
Yes, I'm likely to create a jira tomorrow, but it won't be a nice one with a clear test case
Moved it to a one-time-only printed INFO log line.

Thanks a lot, Andreas!
Do you have a date in mind for the 2.15?
This project has moved from Jira to GitHub Issues. This issue was migrated to apache/maven-surefire#1648.
